meanings.definition: The quality or state of being swift.
meanings.sent1: Her swiftnesses in running helped her win the race.
meanings.sent2: The cheetah's swiftnesses allowed it to catch its prey easily.
meanings.sent3: The swiftnesses of the tortoise racing against the hare was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: Time flew by with the swiftnesses of a shooting star.
meanings.sent5: The swiftnesses of the river's current carried the boat downstream rapidly.

meanings.definition: The act or quality of moving swiftly.
meanings.sent1: The swiftnesses of the horse impressed the spectators at the race.
meanings.sent2: I was amazed by the swiftnesses of the athlete as he sprinted towards the finish line.
meanings.sent3: The swiftnesses of the squirrel darting across the yard was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The swiftnesses of the wind carried the kite high up into the sky.
meanings.sent5: The swiftnesses of the car on the highway made the journey quick and enjoyable.
